sen.e: The 1st generation and the founder of the house is the 5th prince of Emperor Kameyama, Imperial Prince Moriyoshi, however, his estates were forced to be given not to his real son but to the son (latter day Fukakusa no miya) of the Imperial Prince Hisaaki (Jimyoin-to) by an intervention of Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の介入により二代五辻宮となった深草宮は、元徳元年（1329年）9月には、北条守時によって五辻の館と備前国草部郷の領地を安堵されたが、その後、五辻の館のみ元の所有者であった守良親王に戻された。
sen.e: Fukakusa no miya who became the 2nd Itsutsuji no miya by intervention of Kamankura bakufu was received Shoryo Ando (act of providing authorization for land ownership and guaranteeing feudal tenure) of Itsutsuji no yakata and domain at Kusakabe-go, Bizen Province by Moritoki HOJO in September 1329, however, only Itsutsuji no yakata was returned to the ex-owner, the Imperial Prince Moriyoshi.
